name: Community Health Center COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Danbury (Danbury Mall) - Drive Thru
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.   Site Name: Community Health Center - COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Danbury Mall Address: 7 Backus Ave, Danbury CT 06810 Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.  Appointment Scheduling: No appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. If individuals choose to schedule an appointment they can call 860-347-6971.			 Consent form needed to be filled out for minor ages 12+ that are unaccompanied by a parent or guardian. Click on the consent form link https://www.chc1.com/covid-19-vaccine/.   Access: This is a drive thru site requiring individuals to be in a vehicle. Individuals being driven to the site should sit in the rear seat on the driver side so that the provider can vaccinate the left arm, unless they have a need for the right arm to be vaccinated.  What to Bring: Insurance card (if insured)  Additional Information: Individuals will need to remain on site for 15-30 minutes after the vaccine for monitoring.

name: East Shore District Health Department COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Branford (Church Street)
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location. Site Name: East Shore District Health Department - BranfordAddress: 46 Church Street, Branford, CT 06405 Hours: Appointment availability will vary based on vaccine supply (appointment required)Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS). Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about the process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address. Individuals without computer access or need assistance with scheduling an appointment can call 203-481-4233 ext. 582What to Bring: A form of identification and health insurance cardsAccess: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles.

name: Stratford Health Department COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.Site Name: Stratford Health CLinic - COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - StratfordAddress: 468 Birdseye Street, Stratford, CT 06614Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS). Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about the process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address. While individuals are at the clinic, they will be provided information on the process to schedule their next appointment. Individuals are instructed to schedule their second dose prior to leaving the clinic for their first dose.Homebound: Vaccine clinic can vaccinate homebound individuals in their homesWhat to Bring: A form of identification is requested but not required.Additional information:  If a person is hard of hearing, we have access to a small room to eliminate background noise. If a person is deaf and requests the use of sign language, this is available through our language line/video. The minimum age requirement for this clinic is 18. Site reports vaccine administered is Johnson and Johnson, please confirm at arrival. Phone: Persons who do not have access to a computer, may call the health department, 203-385-4090, and provide their name, address, phone number and age, to schedule an appointment.

data.name: Stratford Health Department COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic
data.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Stratford Health CLinic - COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Stratford
Address: 468 Birdseye Street, Stratford, CT 06614
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS). Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about the process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address. While individuals are at the clinic, they will be provided information on the process to schedule their next appointment. Individuals are instructed to schedule their second dose prior to leaving the clinic for their first dose.
Homebound: Vaccine clinic can vaccinate homebound individuals in their homes
What to Bring: A form of identification is requested but not required.
Additional information: If a person is hard of hearing, we have access to a small room to eliminate background noise. If a person is deaf and requests the use of sign language, this is available through our language line/video. The minimum age requirement for this clinic is 18. Site reports vaccine administered is Johnson and Johnson, please confirm at arrival.
Phone: Persons who do not have access to a computer, may call the health department, 203-385-4090, and provide their name, address, phone number and age, to schedule an appointment.

name: Windham Community Memorial Hospital COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.Site Name: Windham Community Hospital - COVID-19 Vaccine ClinicAddress: 112 Mansfield Avenue, Windham, CT Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Scheduling: Individuals currently eligible for the vaccine may schedule an appointment at a Hartford Healthcare vaccination clinic through MyChartPLUS. notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location. Site Name: UConn Health - Willis Nichols Hawley Armory BuildingAddress: 359 Mansfield Road, Storrs, CT 06269Access: This is not a drive thru site. Individuals access the vaccination clinic on foot. Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: UCONN Health eligible patients with an existing MyChart account can log into https://mychart.uconn.edu and click on ‘SCHEDULE COVID VACCINE DOSE 1 FOR THOSE ELIGIBLE.' If one is not a current MyChart user, they can sign up for MyChart at https://mychart.uconn.edu. For any MyChart questions or technical difficulties during regular business hours, contact 860-679-4400. Individuals who need help with scheduling an appointment at this location may call UCONN's dedicated COVID Vaccine Scheduling line at 860-679-5589. For general questions about the vaccine, call the UCONN COVID Vaccine Call Center at 860-679-8888. What to Bring: Proof of identification and insurance card. Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. Additional Information: Individuals that need an interpreter service should notify this site of their language needs when making their appointment. Interpreters are available on site. ADA accommodations at this site include handicap accessible parking, ground level entrance, wheelchair offering, and automatic doors. TTY 860-679-2242

name: Pomperaug Health District COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Southbury (PDDH Office)
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.Site Name: Pomperaug Health DistrictAddress:77 Main Street North- Suite 205, Southbury, CT 06488Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Individuals can make an appointment at this location online at the health district's website or by phone.  Online: Individuals can visit the health district's website at https://www.pddh.org/programs/covid-19-vaccination.php and click on the link for 'Appointments for People 65 years & Older - at PDDH Office' to book an appointment through the website. New users will be prompted to create an account before they can use the online scheduling system. Phone: Individuals without internet access can call 203-264-9616 (ext. 7) to make an appointment.  Second Dose Scheduling: Patients must schedule an appointment for a second dose at the time of their first vaccination. What to Bring: Insurance card, completed consent form (link in confirmation email or a copy can be picked up at the office)Access: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. There are ramps into the building and elevator access to the 2nd floor.Additional Information: Patients should arrive at the clinic 5 minutes ahead of their appointment and plan on being there for 30-45 minutes. There is a 15 minute observation time after receiving the vaccine.

data.name: Pomperaug Health District COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Southbury (PDDH Office)
data.description:
Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.

Site Name: Pomperaug Health District
Address:77 Main Street North- Suite 205, Southbury, CT 06488
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Individuals can make an appointment at this location online at the health district's website or by phone.
  • Online: Individuals can visit the health district's website at https://www.pddh.org/programs/covid-19-vaccination.php and click on the link for 'Appointments for People 65 years & Older - at PDDH Office' to book an appointment through the website. New users will be prompted to create an account before they can use the online scheduling system.
  • Phone: Individuals without internet access can call 203-264-9616 (ext. 7) to make an appointment.
  • Second Dose Scheduling: Patients must schedule an appointment for a second dose at the time of their first vaccination.
What to Bring: Insurance card, completed consent form (link in confirmation email or a copy can be picked up at the office)
Access: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. There are ramps into the building and elevator access to the 2nd floor.
Additional Information: Patients should arrive at the clinic 5 minutes ahead of their appointment and plan on being there for 30-45 minutes. There is a 15 minute observation time after receiving the vaccine.

name: Hartford Healthcare Medical Group COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Southington
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location. Site Name: Hartford Healthcare Medical Group - Southington Address: 81 Meriden Avenue, 3rd Floor, Southington, CTVaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: Individuals currently eligible for the vaccine may schedule an appointment at a Hartford Healthcare vaccination clinic through MyChartPLUS. Hartford Healthcare patients with an existing MyChartPLUS account can log into mychartplus.org and click ‘Schedule an Appointment’, which is listed under ‘Visits’ at the top. Eligible individuals without a MyChartPLUS account must first create an account and then they may schedule an appointment. If you'd prefer to schedule your appointment by phone, call the Hartford HealthCare Access Center at 860-827-7690 or toll-free at 833-943-5721. The Access Center is available  M-F: 8am-5pm. For questions or assistance with scheduling appointments through MyChartPLUS, please call 860-972-4993. Access: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. Additional Information: Vaccines will be administered in the school gymnasium. The entrance is in the rear of the building.

notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location. Site Name: Meriden Senior CenterAddress: 22 West Main Street, Meriden, CT 06451 Hours: Days and times will vary (Appointment Required)Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are available to individuals eligible to receive the vaccine. Individuals do not need to be Meriden residents. To schedule an appointment, individuals should call 203-630-4221 or 203-630-4226. All clinics are held at the Senior Center located at 22 West Main Street, Meriden.Accessibility: This is a walk thru site where individuals leave their vehicles to enter the vaccine clinic. name: UCONN Health COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Munson Road
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location. Site Name: UConn Health Address: 16 Munson Road, Farmington 06032 Access: This is not a drive thru site. Individuals access the vaccination clinic on foot. Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: UCONN Health eligible patients with an existing MyChart account can log into https://mychart.uconn.edu and click on ‘SCHEDULE COVID VACCINE DOSE 1 FOR THOSE ELIGIBLE.' If one is not a current MyChart user, they can sign up for MyChart at https://mychart.uconn.edu. For any MyChart questions or technical difficulties during regular business hours, contact 860-679-4400. Individuals who need help with scheduling an appointment at this location may call UCONN's dedicated COVID Vaccine Scheduling line at 860-679-5589. For general questions about the vaccine, call the UCONN COVID Vaccine Call Center at 860-679-8888. What to Bring: Proof of identification and insurance card. Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. Additional Information: Individuals that need an interpreter service should notify this site of their language needs when making their appointment. Interpreters are available on site. ADA accommodations at this site include handicap accessible parking, ground level entrance, wheelchair offering, and automatic doors. TTY 860-679-2242

name: Sanitas Medical Center COVID-19 Vaccine Clinic - Newington
notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location.Site Name: Santias Medical Center - NewingtonAddress: 196 Kitts Lane, Newington, CT 06111Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment. Appointment Scheduling: Appointments are required for all vaccine recipients. Eligible individuals can schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS). Individuals can complete an enrollment form to gain access to VAMS to schedule themselves. The enrollment form and more information about the process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support. After the enrollment form is completed, individuals will receive an email from VAMS allowing them to log in and schedule a vaccine appointment (the email invitation for eligible individuals should arrive within 12 hours). To use VAMS, participants must have internet access and an email address. Individuals can call to schedule an appointment at 844-307-4827. Individuals scheduling appointments by phone must make sure to also, schedule second vaccine dose appointment.

notes: Please see below (or click on the ‘More Details’ button) for information about which groups are currently being vaccinated, how to schedule an appointment, and other important details about this vaccination location. Walk-ups available Monday-Friday, 9am-3:30pm; T, Th, vaccines are offered until 6:30pm. No appointment necessary.

Address: 21 and 39 Grand Street, Hartford, CT 06106
Vaccine Eligibility: Click here for information about who is currently eligible to schedule a vaccine appointment.
Appointment Scheduling: Walk-ins are welcomed for all vaccine recipients. Appointments can be scheduled by calling The Charter Oak Health Center directly at 860-550-7540 or by accessing the following link https://form.jotform.com/210823615048148.
Individuals can also schedule an appointment at this location online through the Vaccination Administration Management System (VAMS). The enrollment form and more information about the process can be found at https://portal.ct.gov/Coronavirus/COVID-19-Vaccinations---VAMS-Support.

Phone: Appointments can also be made by calling the Charter Oak COVID line at 860-550-7540.
  • Second Dose Scheduling: For patients that do not schedule their appointment in VAMS and receive their 1st dose at COHC, they will be provided with an appointment to receive the 2nd dose at check-in.
What to Bring: Photo ID, insurance card
Accessibility: This is a walk thru site requiring individuals to leave their vehicles. There are accommodations for individuals with physical impairments.
Additional Information: Interpretation services are available to individuals that do not speak English.
